title: Catalog product images + static generated assets + XXL/XXXL size UI support

requirements.summary: Ensure catalog product cards and product detail pages always render real, non-broken product images (including multi-image galleries) for all products.
acceptanceCriteria: All seeded catalog products returned by the backend include at least 1 valid image URL.
Category pages render product cards with a non-placeholder image for all seeded products.
Product detail pages render a working image gallery for products with multiple images.
No catalog product image URLs point to non-working placeholder domains (e.g., example.com).

file_operations.description: Harden product card image rendering: prefer the first valid image URL, add an image load error fallback that switches to a known-good local generated asset, and avoid showing broken images.

Harden product detail gallery rendering: sanitize the incoming images list (remove empty values), handle broken image loads by falling back to a known-good local generated asset, and keep carousel/thumbnail navigation functional with multiple images.

Ensure the product detail page passes a safe, non-empty image array to ProductGallery (and provides a local generated fallback when imageUrls are missing/invalid) so the gallery never displays broken images.

Update cart item thumbnail rendering to match catalog behavior (use first valid image URL, add onError fallback to a known-good local generated asset) to prevent broken images throughout the shopping flow.

requirements.summary: Add the required product images as static frontend assets under frontend/public/assets/generated so the UI can load them from static paths.
acceptanceCriteria: All new product image files are present under frontend/public/assets/generated (or a subfolder) and are served by the frontend as static assets.
Backend seed data uses static asset paths (e.g., /assets/generated/...) in imageUrls so the frontend can load them without backend image serving.
No backend endpoint is added to serve images.

requirements.summary: Support XXL and XXXL size variants in the size selection UI with correct labels and selection behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: Backend Size type includes XXL and XXXL variants and compiles successfully.
Seeded apparel products that logically support extended sizes include XXL and/or XXXL in availableSizes.
Frontend size selector shows XXL and XXXL as labels (e.g., "XXL", "XXXL") and can add items to cart using these sizes without runtime errors.

file_operations.description: Extend the size label map to include xxl -> "XXL" and xxxl -> "XXXL" and ensure all Size enum values used by the backend are safely label-rendered.
Verify size selection/add-to-cart behavior remains valid with the new XXL/XXXL sizes (no runtime errors when selecting and adding to cart).
